latest.title: Form 8.5 (EPT/NON-RI)
latest.content:
Today 08:56
RNS Number : 5876S
Cavendish Securities PLC
11 February 2026
FORM 8.5 (EPT/NON-RI)
PUBLIC OPENING POSITION DISCLOSURE/DEALING DISCLOSURE BY AN
EXEMPT PRINCIPAL TRADER WITHOUT RECOGNISED INTERMEDIARY ("RI") STATUS (OR WHERE RI STATUS IS NOT APPLICABLE)
Rule 8.5 of the Takeover Code (the "Code")
1. KEY INFORMATION
(a) Name of exempt principal trader:
Cavendish Securities Plc
(b) Name of offeror/offeree in relation to whose relevant securities this form relates:
Use a separate form for each offeror/offeree
AUDIOBOOM GROUP PLC
(c) Name of the party to the offer with which exempt principal trader is connected:
AUDIOBOOM GROUP PLC
(d) Date position held/dealing undertaken:
For an opening position disclosure, state the latest practicable date prior to the disclosure
10/02/2026
(e) In addition to the company in 1(b) above, is the exempt principal trader making disclosures in respect of any other party to the offer?
If it is a cash offer or possible cash offer, state "N/A"
N/A
2. POSITIONS OF THE EXEMPT PRINCIPAL TRADER
If there are positions or rights to subscribe to disclose in more than one class of relevant securities of the offeror or offeree named in 1(b), copy table 2(a) or (b) (as appropriate) for each additional class of relevant security.
(a) Interests and short positions in the relevant securities of the offeror or offeree to which the disclosure relates following the dealing (if any)
Class of relevant security:
ORD 0.5P
Interests
Short positions
Number
%
Number
%
(1) Relevant securities owned and/or controlled:
10859
0.06
(2) Cash-settled derivatives:
(3) Stock-settled derivatives (including options) and agreements to purchase/sell:
TOTAL:
10859
0.06
All interests and all short positions should be disclosed.
Details of any open stock-settled derivative positions (including traded options), or agreements to purchase or sell relevant securities, should be given on a Supplemental Form 8 (Open Positions).
(b) Rights to subscribe for new securities (including directors' and other employee options)
Class of relevant security in relation to which subscription right exists:
Details, including nature of the rights concerned and relevant percentages:
3. DEALINGS (IF ANY) BY THE EXEMPT PRINCIPAL TRADER
Where there have been dealings in more than one class of relevant securities of the offeror or offeree named in 1(b), copy table 3(a), (b), (c) or (d) (as appropriate) for each additional class of relevant security dealt in.
The currency of all prices and other monetary amounts should be stated.
(a) Purchases and sales
Class of relevant security
Purchases/ sales
Total number of securities
Highest price per unit paid/received
Lowest price per unit paid/received
ORD 0.5P
ORD 0.5P
Sales
Purchase
6256
1
649.7
620
639.8
620
(b) Cash-settled derivative transactions
Class of relevant security
Product description
e.g. CFD
Nature of dealing
e.g. opening/closing a long/short position, increasing/reducing a long/short position
Number of reference securities
Price per unit
(c) Stock-settled derivative transactions (including options)
(i) Writing, selling, purchasing or varying
Class of relevant security
Product description
e.g. call option
Writing, purchasing, selling, varying etc.
Number of securities to which option relates
Exercise price per unit
Type
e.g. American, European etc.
Expiry date
Option money paid/ received per unit
(ii) Exercise
Class of relevant security
Product description
e.g. call option
Exercising/ exercised against
Number of securities
Exercise price per unit
(d) Other dealings (including subscribing for new securities)
Class of relevant security
Nature of dealing
e.g. subscription, conversion
Details
Price per unit (if applicable)
4. OTHER INFORMATION
(a) Indemnity and other dealing arrangements
Details of any indemnity or option arrangement, or any agreement or understanding, formal or informal, relating to relevant securities which may be an inducement to deal or refrain from dealing entered into by the exempt principal trader making the disclosure and any party to the offer or any person acting in concert with a party to the offer:
Irrevocable commitments and letters of intent should not be included. If there are no such agreements, arrangements or understandings, state "none"
None
(b) Agreements, arrangements or understandings relating to options or derivatives
Details of any agreement, arrangement or understanding, formal or informal, between the exempt principal trader making the disclosure and any other person relating to:
(i) the voting rights of any relevant securities under any option; or
(ii) the voting rights or future acquisition or disposal of any relevant securities to which any derivative is referenced:
If there are no such agreements, arrangements or understandings, state "none"
None
(c) Attachments
Is a Supplemental Form 8 (Open Positions) attached?
NO
Date of disclosure:
11/02/2026
Contact name:
Umika Patel
Telephone number:
+44 (0) 20 7220 0529
Public disclosures under Rule 8 of the Code must be made to a Regulatory Information Service.
The Panel's Market Surveillance Unit is available for consultation in relation to the Code's disclosure requirements on +44 (0)20 7638 0129.
The Code can be viewed on the Panel's website at
www.thetakeoverpanel.org.uk
.

.RNS may use your IP address to confirm compliance with the terms and conditions, to analyse how you engage with the information contained in this communication, and to share such analysis on an anonymised basis with others as part of our commercial services. company_30s.what_they_do: Audioboom runs a platform that lets podcasters host, distribute, and monetize their shows. It also owns a network of popular podcasts and offers analytics and ad‑sales tools for creators and brands.
company_30s.why_they_matter: Podcasts are a fast‑growing media channel and advertisers are pouring money into audio ads. Audioboom sits at the heart of that ecosystem, turning creative output into revenue streams for both creators and advertisers.
company_30s.current_state: The business is still scaling – it has a solid user base but is burning cash as it expands its platform and content library. With no recent earnings or partnership announcements, the stock has been quiet and has traded near its lows in recent weeks.

rns_narrative: The company has stayed quiet on the news front, which is typical for a platform that is still fine‑tuning its product and waiting for the next big partnership or monetization push.
The lack of announcements can be a sign that the company has wrapped up a major capital‑raising round or reached a point of operational stability, setting the stage for a surprise announcement later.
If a new podcast network deal or a revenue‑share agreement with a big brand materialises, it could act as a catalyst that the market has been waiting for.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: Total abandonment – no one is talking about the stock.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: None – the only bullish chatter comes from a handful of traders who are looking for a contrarian entry.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Bears are shouting about cash burn and lack of growth, but with no recent upside catalysts, the pessimism is at a ceiling.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: The conversation moved from frantic selling to quiet apathy, which is a classic sign that capitulation may be finished.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends is flat – the public has almost no interest in the stock, which means a surprise catalyst could catch everyone off guard.

near_term_catalysts: A quarterly earnings report that shows higher‑than‑expected revenue from podcast ad sales.
Announcement of a new partnership with a major streaming platform or brand that expands the monetization pipeline.
A platform upgrade that unlocks a new revenue stream for podcasters, such as a subscription‑based model.
A volume spike on the daily chart that breaks out of the low‑volume consolidation zone, signalling a potential breakout.
expect_next.watch_for: Look for a daily close above the 200‑day moving average with a spike in trading volume, or a surge in short interest that starts to decline – both are classic signs that the market is starting to cover losses.
expect_next.timing_regime: The stock appears to be in the late‑stage washout phase of a deep crash, which is the sweet spot for contrarian buyers who are ready to step in before the next rally.

buy_vs_sell.lean: Contrarian Bullish – the stock meets the deep‑crash profile and there are no terminal risks. The lack of noise and dead trends make it a prime candidate for a mean‑reversion play.
buy_vs_sell.bull_case: A GREEN‑type signal historically returns about 40% on average, but if the stock is 80% down from its peak, a 200% bounce would bring it back to the previous high. The compressed spring of the price curve means a single catalyst could unleash a big move.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: The main downside is that the company may continue to burn cash if it fails to secure a new partnership or revenue stream. However, most of the worst‑case loss is already behind the current price.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: Risk 20% down if the rally stalls vs Reward 200% up if the bounce hits the previous high – an asymmetry of roughly 1:10.

playbook.if_bullish: Enter with 20% of your allocation at the current price, keep a tight stop 5% below the low of the last 10 days, and add 10% on each volume spike that confirms a breakout. If the rally reaches the previous high, consider taking profit or scaling out.
playbook.if_watching: Hold until you see a clear daily close above the 200‑day moving average and a 3‑day volume spike. Also wait for any earnings or partnership announcement before committing.
playbook.if_passing: Skip if you see any regulatory or delisting risk, or if the company’s cash burn turns into a liquidity crisis that forces a sale of shares.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Deep‑crash contrarian play – quiet market, dead trends, and a potential catalyst could trigger a 200% bounce, giving a 1:10 risk‑reward edge.
